lines.text:
[looking at the Kid's gun]
Seven motches, eh?
There were only six when our trails crossed last. There's room for one more; then I'm going to have to break in a new gun.

[examining the gun]
One shot fired recently. That last shot filled out your dead man's tally. I'll bet it was fired at somebody... probably in the back.

[offering a drink]
The best in the house is yours.
I reckon the Range Busters contrived a welcome for the young lady you couldn't match, Brand.
I heard about that... We're aimin' to drink to the boys. They'd be pleased if they knew you joined us.
I appreciate your sentiment, gentlemen. I'll rmember them when I'm drinking my coffee.

[turning the tables]
You need leons in trailoin' Mister.
No, I was just evadin' the truth. Now get off your horse!
Well, it's beginning to add up.
Yeah, it looks like I'll be wearin' my old blue coat again.
What's the coat got to do with it?
Whenever I'm to face bullets, I always put it on, feelin' I'll die more comfortable with it wrapped around me.
That's right, and it's gonna take the sons of the Blue and Grey to hold it.
There's another old galoot in this town is just about of the same notion - though the coat he favors is gray.
Took men of your breed, Jed, to build and mold this good old earth.
